text: Kailash Patil is Indian football player playing for club ONGC FC, ==Career== He scored 2 goals for ONGC F.C. against Hindustan Aeronautics Limited S.C. on 9 April 2011. He previously played for Air India. He Scored 2 more goals against Mohan Bagan A.C. on 24 April 2011, to give ONGC win. He was playing local tournaments, when Rashtriya Chemicals and Fertilizers (RCF) coach Kishor Khedkar spotted him and brought him to Mumbai. He had a successful 2005 season with RCF. He was injured for most of 2006 and returned to RCF at the end of the next year with a slightly better salary. Success in the local Mumbai District Football Association’s league got him the best player’s award, and earned him Air India FC’s attention. He played for it for the first time in the 2009 season.Kailash Patil | ‘I am always looking for opportunities’ - Views - livemint.com ==Career statistics== ===Club=== Statistics accurate as of 11 May 2013 {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%; text-align:center;" |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="2"|League !colspan="2"|Federation Cup !colspan="2"|Durand Cup !colspan="2"|AFC !colspan="2"|Total |- !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals |- | rowspan="1"| ONGC |2012-13 |18||0||0||0||0||0||—||—||18||0 |- ! colspan="2" | Career total !18!!0!!0!!0!!0!!0!!0!!0!!18!!0 |} ==References== Category:Living people Category:1987 births Category:People from Kolhapur Category:Footballers from Maharashtra Category:Air India F.C. players Category:ONGC F.C. players Category:I-League players Category:Indian footballers Category:Association football forwards
